metadata.title: CVE-2019-9788 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 65, Firefox ESR 60.5, and Thunderbird 60.5. Some ofthese bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code.This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.6, Firefox ESR < 60.6, andFirefox < 66.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.6.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
